text: Edward Michael "Bear" Grylls (born 7 June 1974) is an English-Irish Bear Grylls reveals surprising Irish connection during appearance in Dublin, Evoke, 9 January 2020 adventurer. He has been the Chief Scout since 2009. He climbed Mount Everest when he was 23. He broke the record for the youngest British person to climb the mountain. Grylls has been in many television programmes. Grylls was born in London and grew up in Donaghadee, County Down and Bembridge, Isle of Wight. He was educated at Eton College and Birkbeck, University of London. He served in the S.A.S. and is a Christian.Bear Grylls: My Christian faith is my backbone, Christian Today, 8 September 2015 His wife is Shara Cannings Knight and his parents are the late Conservative MP Sir Michael Grylls and Lady Grylls (she is of Irish origin). ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1974 births Category:Living people Category:British military people Category:English Anglicans Category:English television personalities Category:British mountain climbers Category:Officers of the Order of the British Empire Category:People educated at Eton College Category:Sportspeople from London Category:People from the Isle of Wight Category:Sportspeople from the Republic of Ireland
